Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class GameExpertMode

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Game
it.polimi.ingsw.model.GameExpertMode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class GameExpertMode extends Game implements Serializable
This class is the same as the Game class, but it handles Expert mode matches. Therefore, it has methods for Character Cards handling, and it is controlled by the GameControllerExpertMode.
See Also:

      constants - the useful constants to set for this game.

  • Method Details

    • getCharacters

      public CharacterCard[] getCharacters()
      Returns an array containing all the 3 Character Cards available for this game.
      Returns:
      an array of CharacterCard subclasses (each one is different, since each card present in the game is different).

    • getCharacterCardByID

      public CharacterCard getCharacterCardByID(int id) throws NoSuchElementException
      Returns the Character Card with the given ID between the ones present in the current game, if possible.
      Parameters:
      id - an int representing the ID of the desired card.
      Returns:
      the desired CharacterCard.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if there's no Character Card with the given ID in the current game.

    • playerPlaysCharacterCard

      public void playerPlaysCharacterCard(int id) throws TryAgainException
      Allows the current player to play a chosen Character Card. If it involves a change in an already existent method, its effect will not be visible right after use; otherwise, the card's doEffect method will be instantly triggered.
      Parameters:
      id - an int representing the ID of the card to play.
      Throws:
      TryAgainException - if the desired card can't be played. This may happen because of the first true conditions along the following: 1) the current player has already played a Character Card in the same round - actually, this exception should never be thrown here (GameControllerExpertMode should prevent this case), but it has been kept for safety. 2) the current player has not enough coins to activate the card's effect. 3) the Character Card ID provided does not refer to any of the existing 3 cards in the current game. As the exception name suggests, it is then asked the current player to provide input again.

    • moveMotherNature

      public void moveMotherNature(int steps) throws InvalidNumberOfStepsException
      Checks if the card which modifies Mother Nature's maximum number of steps has been activated by the current player. In case it has, calls the card's doEffect method; in case it hasn't, this method is identical to the overridden one.
      Overrides:
      moveMotherNature in class Game
      Parameters:
      steps - an int representing the number of steps the player wishes Mother Nature to move of.
      Throws:
      InvalidNumberOfStepsException - if the provided number of steps violates the game's rules.

    • profCheck

      public void profCheck() throws NonExistentColorException
      Checks if the card which modifies the profCheck algorithm has been activated by the current player. In case it has, calls the card's doEffect method; in case it hasn't, this method is identical to the overridden one.
      Overrides:
      profCheck in class Game
      Throws:
      NonExistentColorException - if a table of a non-existent color is somehow accessed (it should never be thrown, so it is safely ignorable).

    • islandConquerCheck

      public void islandConquerCheck(int islandID) throws IslandNotFoundException
      Checks if one of the cards which modify the islandConquerCheck algorithm has been activated by the current player. In case one of them have, calls the card's doEffect method; in case none of them have, this method is identical to the overridden one.
      Overrides:
      islandConquerCheck in class Game
      Parameters:
      islandID - the ID of the island to check.
      Throws:
      IslandNotFoundException - if the provided ID does not correspond to any of the existing islands.

    • addCharacterCards

      public void addCharacterCards(CharacterCard[] cards)
      Adds the given set of Character Cards to the game.
      Parameters:
      cards - the array containing the Character Cards to add to the game.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Fills the players' halls with the right amount of students and shuffles the players' order at the beginning of the match, in order to start the game properly (just as the overridden method does). Plus, generates a random set of 3 different Character Cards and adds them to the game.
      Overrides:
      startGame in class Game

    • showGameBoard

      public void showGameBoard()
      Allows the CLI to properly show the game status (Expert mode).
      Overrides:
      showGameBoard in class Game
